thread.title: Texans backup QB Ryan Mallett misses team flight to Miami
thread.title_full: Texans backup QB Ryan Mallett misses team flight to Miami - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Texans backup QB Ryan Mallett misses team flight to Miami
text:
Eric Christian Smith/AP When he's not sleeping through practice, Texans QB Ryan Mallett misses team flights. The Texans' patience with Ryan Mallett probably is wearing thin.
The backup quarterback missed the team's charter flight to Miami on Saturday and needed to fly commercial to join the team ahead of its Sunday matchup with the Dolphins, according to the Houston Chronicle . Mallett will be fined, the report said.
Houston has two quarterbacks on the active roster. Tom Savage is on injured reserve and Zac Dysert is on the practice squad.
Mallett gained notoriety during training camp for missing a practice after, according to Mallett, his alarm didn't go off because his cell phone battery died. He was fined over the incident, which came the same week Mallett lost the starting quarterback job to Brian Hoyer.
 HERE.
After just one game Mallett took over and started Houston's next four games, but when he briefly got hurt against the Colts in Week 5, Hoyer entered the game and played well enough to stay in as Mallett appeared displeased on the sideline that he didn't return. Hoyer has held the job since.
Related Stories Sunday Morning QB: 10 more years of Brady? Bad news for Jets Giants' showdown with Cowboys about reversing 2014 Tags: ryan mallett , houston texans , miami dolphins
